newsitem.title: USA: U.S. equity fund flows jump in 2-day period-survey.
newsitem.headline: U.S. equity fund flows jump in 2-day period-survey.

text.p: Industrywide cash flows into U.S. stock mutual funds jumped to an estimated $2.23 billion for the two days ended May 12, compared with $1.01 billion for the three days ended May 8, according to a survey by Mutual Fund Trim Tabs.
Aggressive growth funds jumped to inflows of $599 million from outflows of $93 million, the fund tracking firm found. Growth funds rose to inflows of $761 million from inflows of $180 million.
International funds rocketed to inflows of $1.39 billion from outflows of $513 million.

Bond funds rose to inflows of $407 million from outflows of $185 million. Muni funds rose to inflows of $522 million from outflows of $703 million. Flexible/balanced/mixed funds increased to inflows of $111 million from inflows of $48 million.
High yield funds had outflows of $88 million versus inflows of $373 million.
